metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14498 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
get_8bit_row in rdbmp.c in libjpeg-turbo through 1.5.90 and MozJPEG through 3.3.1 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via a crafted 8-bit BMP in which one or more of the color indices is out of range for the number of palette entries.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14498` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1+esm2
libjpeg-turbo-test - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1+esm2
libjpeg-turbo8 - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1+esm2
libturbojpeg - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libjpeg-turbo package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1+esm2').
